name: Ho-Oh
flavorText: A legend says that its body glows in seven colors. A rainbow is said to form behind when it flies.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Lugia
flavorText: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea because its powers are too strong.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Pikachu. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy attached to Pikachu.

name: Wobbuffet
flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
Ability1Text: As long as Wobbuffet is your Active Pokemon, your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Hoothoot
flavorText: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.

name: Noctowl
flavorText: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Noctowl is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Feraligatr
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy from your hand to 1 of your Water Pokemon. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Meganium
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Grass Energy attached to 1 of your Pokemon to another of your Pokemon. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Typhlosion
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon. If you do, put 1 damage counter on that Pokemon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy card attached to Typhlosion and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Latias
flavorText: It communicates using telepathy. Its body is covered in down that refracts light to make it invisible.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If Latios is on your Bench, remove 2 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Latios
flavorText: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokemon that dislikes fighting.
Ability1Text: If you have Latias in play, the Retreat Cost for Latios is 0.

name: Cleffa
flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Ability1Text: As long as Cleffa is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Cleffa by attacks.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards. Cleffa is now Asleep.

name: Smoochum
flavorText: Its lips are the most sensitive part of its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.
Ability1Text: As long as Smoochum is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Smoochum by attacks.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon. Smoochum is now Asleep.

name: Lapras
flavorText: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

name: Shuckle
flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Shuckle, draw a card.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shuckle by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Plusle
flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Plusle does 10 damage to itself.

name: Minun
flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Raikou
flavorText: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Raikou can't use Zap Cannon.

name: Entei
flavorText: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to contain its sheer power, it races headlong around the land.
Attack1Text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Entei.

name: Suicune
flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Porygon
flavorText: It is a manmade Pokemon. Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment..
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Porygon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Search your deck for Porygon2, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Porygon2
flavorText: This upgraded version of Porygon is designed for space exploration. It can't fly, though.
Ability1Text: The Retreat Cost for each Porygon, Porygon2, and Porygon-Z you have in play is Colorless less.

name: Hitmonchan
flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Hitmonlee
flavorText: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
